tier_1_determinative.ipc_sections_charged: IPC Section 394 read with Section 34, Sections 3(1)(ii) and 3(4) of the Maharashtra Control of Organized Crimes Act, 1999

tier_2_material.motive_for_crime: The Applicant is alleged to be involved in organized crime as a gang leader, indicating a motive related to organized criminal activities.

tier_3_contextual.place_of_offense: Mulshi dam, where the first informant was robbed.

tier_4_procedural.case_title: Bhagwan Babu Margale vs. The State of Maharashtra
tier_4_procedural.court_name: High Court of Judicature at Bombay
tier_4_procedural.sections_invoked: Section 394 read with Section 34 of IPC; Sections 3(1)(ii) and 3(4) of MCOCA, 1999
tier_4_procedural.acts_and_sections: Indian Penal Code, Maharashtra Control of Organized Crimes Act, 1999

residual_details.additional_facts: The Applicant was identified by the first informant under an hour of the occurrence and was apprehended red-handed. The applicant is alleged to have made a confession admissible under Section 18 of the MCOC Act, 1999. As many as 11 crimes have been registered against the applicant, with 9 cases involving robbery and dacoity.
